comment.author: 60969104@N02
comment._content: So awkward, I recognized it almost immediatly, I've been here as a child, and I loved it. This picture is amazing!!

comment.author: 20963518@N00
comment._content: Today (2012) the castle is a private home as well as a museum, a auto veteran museum and an amusement park. You can check it out at the internet, also in English. The Count and his family still lives there. Also there is a green house with sale of plants and flovers. Also you can book for parties or gatherings. It's situated a mere 2 hours drive from Copenhagen airport.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bogeskov] Thank you very much for the tip! I found Egeskov Castle's own home page with recent photographs, old images and lots of interesting information: www.egeskov.dk/en /Anna B.
